abstracts.cdata!:
The Contractual Savings Development Loan
            (CSDL) Project is the first in a series of projects being
            developed by the World Bank and Morocco to improve the
            accumulation and allocation of long-term savings and to
            guarantee the long-term sustainability of the country's
            pension system. The project's main objective is to
            improve the allocation of savings to private productive
            investment by reforming contractual savings institutions,
            including insurance companies, savings banks, and the
            pension system. There are four components. The first 1)
            assists in drafting an insurance code, particularly
            concerning foreign ownership provisions; develops an
            insurance sector restructuring plan, and produces a
            timetable to liquidate damage claims; and agrees on a plan
            and schedule to fully liberalize insurance tariffs. The
            second component launches actuarial studies and external
            audits of the existing pension system; appoints a pension
            reform committee; and authorizes independent management of
            pension fund reserves. The third component introduces
            segregated portfolios for the deposits associated with the
            national social security fund (CNSS) and the national
            savings fund (CEN); and replaces the fixed administered rate
            on deposits with portfolio returns from investments. The
            fourth component drafts legislation on portfolio management,
            secured lending, and money market mutual funds.
